stimulus:
In this experiment, you will be presented with 8 scenarios, which you must read carefully.

After reading each scenario, you will be prompted two comprehension questions: a multiple choice question and a brief open answer question. You will be required to answer both questions for every scenario, meaning 16 questions in total.

To begin the experiment, hit the space bar.

response.Explanation: It sounds as though Alice is trying to hide her feelings by her reply, the exclamation marks look like she's excited her friend now has the same hair as her
I think Catherine is speaking from the euphoria of her PR rather than getting at anyone
He doesn't know he used salt so he'd take the message at face value, as sincere
If the dog is very cute to most people then Margaret's response will sound sarcastic, especially if Julia doesn't know about her aversion to bulldogs

If Eric knows anything about the company he would get the sarcasm, if he doesn't then he'd take it as sincere as this is a fashion magazine manager talking about fashion.  Hard to believe he wouldn't know about an ongoing conflict, I imagine that would be public or at least well-known in those circles
I don't see why he would think sarcastic, just because they fight (brothers often do)
There's nothing to suggest she doesn't mean this
Sounds like a vague thing people say when they are less than thrilled about something!
